file_content.text: Didn't think you were that powerful.
Not bad, for an Imp.
Good moves, hunter.
Good fight, I suppose.
If I hadn't killed those Esh-kha, they would've ripped you apart.
You're welcome.
We owe you, all right.
Two Esh-kha down. Two Republic troops to go.
Now, what to do with you?
Wait! Let's not be hasty.
For me, it was easy.
See, Sarge? Upstanding and strong, like I said.
How about we work out a trade? You let us go, we tell you about a certain something....
Shut up, Corporal. That's an order.
Come on, Sarge. The key to Belsavis's vaults is our ticket outta here.
Corporal Rand's in shock. There is no key.
You're powerless. Surrender the key, or I'll take it.
Don't lie to me, Sergeant.
You can't hide anything from me, Sergeant. Now give me the key.
I can see through your lies.
Your face doesn't lie. The key. Now.
Nice try, Sergeant.
Fork over the key. I'm not asking.
Yeah, right.
You're not in shock, are you, Corporal? What's this about a key?
He doesn't look too bad to me.
It opens any vault in the prison. Give it up, Sarge. Or we'll never get home!
Then I might as well kill you.
Wait! The sarge's bluffing!
Think of your wife--Trea, was it? And the kid. You don't want him growing up without you.
Fine. Let us go and the key's yours.
Captain Black has it. Those... things... took him deeper into this vault.
That settles it. Find Captain Black and the key's all yours. Now just let us go, and we'll leave you in peace.
Sergeant, Corporal, it's been a pleasure.
I'd rather kill you instead.
Wait! Please, I'll do anything!
Don't let the Esh-kha kill you on the way out.
Of course. You can go.
Thank you!
Get moving, Corporal.
Back off, Sith. You don't scare us.
Sarge's joking, my, uh, lord! We're real scared of you!
The Empire's bloodhound. Hope you enjoyed the scent.
I don't know what's worse, those monsters or you scum.
Sarge's joking! Don't hurt us!
Please--you gotta save us before those things come back!
I'm surprised they haven't killed you already.
So you've met the Esh-kha.
We're only alive because they're after something. And it's all your fault.
What's a pair of Republic troops doing in the Esh-kha's vault?
What were you up to down here?
Cleaning up the Empire's mess.
I don't have to do anything.
You better start caring fast. This isn't about the Empire, or the Republic. It's about stopping something horrible.
Your friends woke these monsters. We're here to seal them back up for good.
The dark tomb will not bind us again.
Stay back!
I am Skull Shatter. I speak with fire. Blood Scream bellows thunderous power. You... you are a pestilence.
Many Esh-kha have fallen at my feet. You should've stayed hidden.
You're fools to challenge me.
Bow to your destroyer, and I'll make your end quick.
I'll teach you some manners.
Another insult and I'll drop you where you stand.
Don't try me.
One more step and I'll blast that pretty face of yours.
Watch it, ugly.
Resistance will only amplify your screams.
You're the disease. Your entire species.
You've got it backwards.
You blindly infect the galaxy. But balance is coming.
Do all the Esh-kha speak, or are you the exception?
You can talk?
My caste breathes meaning into the void. The savants feed off our echo.
What are you waiting for? Kill those things!
You defile this planet. Balance will be restored soon.
I'm proud to be a pestilence.
Your plague drains the light. But balance is coming.
I hear the others across this planet, clawing for freedom. We will break their chains and erase your poison.
You're not taking one step outside this vault.
I won't let that happen.
The wave already floods this planet. Soon we will wash away all abominations.
You know Heart Rend? I killed him. His friends too.
I've met the others.
Heart Rend was one drop of the wave. Soon we will wash away your corruption.
Don't tell me there's more of you Esh-kha locked up here.
The others?
Thousands are splintered and caged. Soon the wave will rise and wash away all corruption.
Shut up. [Attack]
Blood Scream--cleanse the horrors.
